entry.title: Armenia, US sign strategic cooperation agreement

media:group.media:title: Armenia, US sign strategic cooperation agreement
media:group.media:description:
üìç In a ceremony held at the U.S. State Department in Washington, Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan and Secretary of State Antony Blinken signed the Strategic Partnership Charter, marking what they called a significant milestone in bilateral relations. üìç Armenia summoned Russia's ambassador to Yerevan today to lodge a formal protest over statements made on Russia's state television that threatened Armenia's sovereignty. üìç The European Union's Commissioner for Enlargement Marta Kos announced today at the European Parliament's Foreign Affairs Committee in Brussels that the EU will thoroughly examine Armenia's potential membership application. üìç An Unflattering Charter. The Pashinyan Government Under Scrutiny: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/812416/an-unflattering-charter-the-pashinyan-government-under-scrutiny/

media:group.media:title: Unpacking the US-Armenia strategic partnership
media:group.media:description:
During the last days of the Biden administration, the United States has signed a strategic partnership agreement with Armenia. We are joined by Benyamin Poghosyan, senior research fellow at the Yerevan-based APRI Armenia think tank, to discuss what the agreement means for the countries‚Äô deepening relationship. In addition, Poghosyan looks ahead to the incoming Trump administration‚Äôs foreign policy and how it could affect the South Caucasus region.
0:00 Introduction 0:32 What‚Äôs the significance of a strategic partnership? 1:32 Security guarantees for Armenia? 3:17 Civilian nuclear energy cooperation 5:27 Diversification of energy supplies away from Russia 6:20 Export controls and border security capacity building 8:25 Future of Russian border guards in Armenia 10:19 Why the agreement now in the Biden administration‚Äôs last days? 13:17 Predicting the Trump administration‚Äôs South Caucasus policy

media:group.media:title: ’Ä’°’µ’°’Ω’ø’°’∂’´ ÷á ‘±’Ñ’Ü-’´ ’¥’´’ª÷á ’º’°’¶’¥’°’æ’°÷Ä’°’Ø’°’∂ ’∞’°’¥’°’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’°’Ø÷Å’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ÷É’°’Ω’ø’°’©’≤’©’´ ’Ω’ø’∏÷Ä’°’£÷Ä’∏÷Ç’¥’®
media:group.media:description:
’Ä’°’µ’°’Ω’ø’°’∂’® ÷á ’Ñ’´’°÷Å’µ’°’¨ ’Ü’°’∞’°’∂’£’∂’•÷Ä’® ’Ω’ø’∏÷Ä’°’£÷Ä’•÷Å’´’∂ ¬´’å’°’¶’¥’°’æ’°÷Ä’°’Ø’°’∂ ’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’®’∂’Ø’•÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ’¥’°’Ω’´’∂ ’Ø’°’∂’∏’∂’°’§÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂¬ª ’Ø’∏’π’æ’∏’≤ ÷É’°’Ω’ø’°’©’∏÷Ç’≤’©’®÷â ’é’°’∑’´’∂’£’ø’∏’∂’∏÷Ç’¥’ù ‘±’Ñ’Ü ’∫’•’ø÷Ñ’°÷Ä’ø’∏÷Ç’≤’°÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∏÷Ç’¥ ’Ø’°’µ’°÷Å’°’Æ ’°÷Ä’°÷Ä’∏’≤’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂’® ÷É’°’Ω’ø’°’©’≤’©’´ ’ø’°’Ø ’´÷Ä’•’∂÷Å ’Ω’ø’∏÷Ä’°’£÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’® ’§÷Ä’•÷Å’´’∂ ‘±’Ñ’Ü ’∫’•’ø÷Ñ’°÷Ä’ø’∏÷Ç’≤’°÷Ä ‘∑’∂’©’∏’∂’´ ‘≤’¨’´’∂÷Ñ’•’∂’® ÷á ’Ä’°’µ’°’Ω’ø’°’∂’´ ’°÷Ä’ø’£’∏÷Ä’Æ’∂’°’≠’°÷Ä’°÷Ä ‘±÷Ä’°÷Ä’°’ø ’Ñ’´÷Ä’¶’∏’µ’°’∂’®÷â
In a ceremony held at the U.S. State Department in Washington, Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan signed the ‚ÄúStrategic Partnership Charter,‚Äù marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.
The comprehensive partnership, as outlined by Secretary Blinken, rests on four main pillars: economic cooperation, security and defense collaboration, democratic development, and people-to-people exchanges. A key economic highlight is the upcoming negotiations for a ‚Äú123 Agreement,‚Äù establishing a legal framework for peaceful nuclear cooperation, including transferring nuclear materials, equipment, and technology under strict security protocols.
On security matters, Blinken announced that a U.S. Customs and Border Patrol team would visit Armenia next month to support capacity-building efforts. The partnership builds on existing military cooperation, including the annual ‚ÄúEagle Partner‚Äù bilateral exercises.
As part of the agreement, Armenia will join the Global Coalition to Defeat ISIS, becoming the 88th member of this international security alliance.
‚ÄúThe Armenian government demonstrates a real commitment to building a more just society. I particularly want to note the work of Prime Minister Pashinyan and his government in implementing reforms in critical areas, especially in justice and law enforcement. Last month at the State Department, we had the honor of presenting one of our anti-corruption leadership awards for exceptional work in fighting corruption,‚Äù Blinken stated.
Blinken emphasized that this strategic partnership ‚Äúwill contribute to forming a more resilient, peaceful, and independent South Caucasus. We are becoming increasingly strong partners, and I believe this serves the interests of both our countries, as well as the region and beyond.‚Äù
Foreign Minister Mirzoyan highlighted the significance of the charter: ‚ÄúThe Armenia-U.S. Strategic Partnership Charter we are signing today provides a robust framework and brings greater ambition to our cooperation.‚Äù
‚ÄúOur relations, based on shared values and mutual interests, have shown remarkable growth in recent years, maturing to a point where upgrading them to a strategic partnership is not only fitting but essential for navigating the complex geopolitical landscape,‚Äù Mirzoyan noted. ‚ÄúWe deeply appreciate the United States‚Äô unwavering support for Armenia‚Äôs independence, sovereignty, and territorial integrity.‚Äù
Mirzoyan concluded by expressing Armenia‚Äôs commitment to the peace agenda and its implementation, emphasizing that the charter would serve as both a testament to deepening strategic relations and a roadmap for a future of shared achievements between the two nations. #CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: Armenia to draft a new constitution before 2026 parliamentary election

media:group.media:title: Armenia to draft a new constitution before 2026 parliamentary election
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs Justice Minister Srbuhi Galyan announced that her ministry aims to have a new constitution text ready before the parliamentary elections scheduled for 2026, while also outlining significant reforms in the judicial system. üìç The Kremlin has expressed its readiness to continue developing its cooperation with Armenia, as Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan travels to Washington to sign a strategic partnership with the United States. üìç Armenia‚Äôs concessions legitimize Azerbaijan‚Äôs coercive actions, expert warns: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/811974/armenias-concessions-legitimize-azerbaijans-coercive-actions-expert-warns/

entry.title: Armenia not leaving Eurasian Economic Union, ministers say

media:group.media:title: Armenia not leaving Eurasian Economic Union, ministers say
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia's Economy Minister Gevorg Papoyan declared today that Armenia has no current plans to exit the Russian-led Eurasian Economic Union, while emphasizing that the country's potential EU membership pursuit would run parallel to existing commitments. üìç Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan reimbursed roughly $19,000 to the municipal budget after controversy erupted over his business trip to Los Angeles in November, when taxpayer funds were used to purchase an expensive flight without conducting the required competitive bidding process for the contract.
